name: Newton's First Law
description: An object remains at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by a force.

name: Newton's Second Law
description: Force is mass times acceleration.

name: Newton's Third Law
description: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

name: Law of Universal Gravitation
description: Gravitational force between two masses.

name: Hooke's Law
description: Force exerted by a spring is proportional to its displacement.

name: Kinetic Energy
description: Kinetic energy of an object in motion.

name: Potential Energy
description: Gravitational potential energy.

name: Work Done
description: Work done by a force over a distance.

name: Power
description: Rate of doing work or energy transfer.

name: Momentum
description: Momentum of a moving object.

name: Impulse
description: Change in momentum.

name: Ohm's Law
description: Voltage is current times resistance.

name: Coulomb's Law
description: Force between two charges.

name: Wave Speed
description: Speed of a wave is frequency times wavelength.

name: Frequency
description: Number of oscillations per second.

name: Density
description: Mass per unit volume.

name: Pressure
description: Force per unit area.

name: Boyle's Law
description: Pressure and volume of a gas are inversely proportional.

name: Charles's Law
description: Volume and temperature of a gas are directly proportional.

name: Ideal Gas Law
description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas.

name: Thermal Conductivity
description: Rate of heat transfer through a material.

name: Specific Heat Capacity
description: Heat energy required to change the temperature of a substance.

name: Latent Heat
description: Heat energy required to change the state of a substance.

name: First Law of Thermodynamics
description: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred.

name: Second Law of Thermodynamics
description: Entropy of an isolated system always increases.

name: Third Law of Thermodynamics
description: As temperature approaches absolute zero, entropy approaches a constant minimum.

name: Snell's Law
description: Relationship between angles of incidence and refraction.

name: Law of Reflection
description: Angle of incidence is equal to angle of reflection.

name: Magnification
description: Ratio of image distance to object distance.

name: Lensmaker's Equation
description: Relationship between focal length, refractive index, and radii of curvature.

name: Photoelectric Effect
description: Energy of emitted electrons is proportional to frequency of incident light.

name: Planck's Equation
description: Energy of a photon is proportional to its frequency.

name: de Broglie Wavelength
description: Wavelength of a particle is inversely proportional to its momentum.

name: Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle
description: It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact position and momentum of a particle.

name: Schrodinger Equation
description: Describes how the quantum state of a physical system changes with time.

name: Einstein's Mass-Energy Equivalence
description: Energy and mass are equivalent and can be converted into each other.

name: Lorentz Transformation
description: Relates time and space coordinates of two observers in relative motion.

name: Special Relativity
description: Relationship between energy, momentum, and mass.

name: General Relativity
description: Describes gravity as a curvature of spacetime.

name: Hubble's Law
description: Recessional velocity of galaxies is proportional to their distance from us.

name: Stefan-Boltzmann Law
description: Total energy radiated per unit surface area of a black body is proportional to the fourth power of its temperature.

name: Wien's Displacement Law
description: Wavelength at which the emission of a black body spectrum is maximized is inversely proportional to temperature.

name: Kirchhoff's Current Law
description: The total current entering a junction is equal to the total current leaving the junction.

name: Kirchhoff's Voltage Law
description: The sum of all electrical potential differences around a loop is zero.

name: Faraday's Law of Induction
description: Induced electromotive force is proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux.

name: Lenz's Law
description: The direction of induced current opposes the change in magnetic flux.

name: Ampere's Law
description: Magnetic field around a closed loop is proportional to the electric current passing through the loop.

name: Gauss's Law
description: Electric flux through a closed surface is proportional to the charge enclosed by the surface.

name: Gauss's Law for Magnetism
description: The net magnetic flux through a closed surface is zero.

name: Archimedes' Principle
description: Buoyant force on an object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.

name: Bernoulli's Principle
description: In a flowing fluid, the sum of pressure, kinetic, and potential energy per unit volume is constant.

name: Pascal's Law
description: In a fluid at rest, a change in pressure at any point is transmitted undiminished throughout the fluid.

name: Continuity Equation
description: The product of the cross-sectional area and velocity of fluid flow is constant along a streamline.

name: Boyle's Law
description: Pressure and volume of a gas are inversely proportional, at constant temperature.

name: Charles's Law
description: Volume and temperature of a gas are directly proportional, at constant pressure.

name: Gay-Lussac's Law
description: Pressure and temperature of a gas are directly proportional, at constant volume.

name: Ideal Gas Law
description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas.

name: First Law of Thermodynamics
description: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred.

name: Second Law of Thermodynamics
description: Entropy of an isolated system always increases.

name: Third Law of Thermodynamics
description: As temperature approaches absolute zero, entropy approaches a constant minimum.

name: Zeroth Law of Thermodynamics
description: If two systems are each in thermal equilibrium with a third system, then they are in thermal equilibrium with each other.

name: Law of Reflection
description: Angle of incidence is equal to angle of reflection.

name: Snell's Law
description: Relationship between angles of incidence and refraction when light passes between two media.

name: Lensmaker's Equation
description: Relationship between focal length, refractive index, and radii of curvature of a lens.

name: Magnification
description: Ratio of image distance to object distance.

name: Coulomb's Law
description: Force between two point charges is proportional to the product of their charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

name: Ohm's Law
description: Voltage across a resistor is equal to the product of the current through the resistor and the resistance.

name: Kirchhoff's Current Law
description: The total current entering a junction equals the total current leaving the junction.

name: Kirchhoff's Voltage Law
description: The sum of all electrical potential differences around a loop is zero.

name: Faraday's Law of Induction
description: Induced electromotive force is proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux.

name: Lenz's Law
description: The direction of induced current opposes the change in magnetic flux.

name: Ampere's Law
description: Magnetic field around a closed loop is proportional to the electric current passing through the loop.

name: Gauss's Law
description: Electric flux through a closed surface is proportional to the charge enclosed by the surface.

name: Gauss's Law for Magnetism
description: The net magnetic flux through a closed surface is zero.

name: Wave Speed
description: Speed of a wave is the product of its frequency and wavelength.

name: Frequency
description: Number of oscillations per unit time.

name: Period
description: Time taken for one complete oscillation.

name: Density
description: Mass per unit volume.

name: Pressure
description: Force per unit area.

name: Impulse
description: Change in momentum.

name: Momentum
description: Product of mass and velocity.

name: Kinetic Energy
description: Energy of a moving object.

name: Potential Energy
description: Energy an object has due to its position in a gravitational field.

name: Work Done
description: Energy transferred by a force moving an object through a distance.

name: Power
description: Rate of doing work.

name: Hooke's Law
description: Force exerted by a spring is proportional to its displacement.

name: Law of Universal Gravitation
description: Gravitational force between two masses is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

name: Archimedes' Principle
description: Buoyant force on an object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.

name: Bernoulli's Principle
description: In a flowing fluid, the sum of pressure, kinetic, and potential energy per unit volume is constant.

name: Pascal's Law
description: In a fluid at rest, a change in pressure at any point is transmitted undiminished throughout the fluid.

name: Continuity Equation
description: The product of the cross-sectional area and velocity of fluid flow is constant along a streamline.

name: Boyle's Law
description: Pressure and volume of a gas are inversely proportional, at constant temperature.

name: Charles's Law
description: Volume and temperature of a gas are directly proportional, at constant pressure.

name: Gay-Lussac's Law
description: Pressure and temperature of a gas are directly proportional, at constant volume.

name: Ideal Gas Law
description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas.
